recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has proposed changes to make the opcode functionally complete and improved.
- The location of the proposal is unclear as the provided link leads to a work in progress comment.
- Dave questions the completeness of the proposal and expected a draft BIP.

recent_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
recent_posts.summary: - Josie argues that expiration dates should be proposed as their own Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) - Josie presents scenarios where expiration dates may cause issues, such as compromised wallets and privacy concerns - Josie suggests an alternative solution of allowing users to revoke silent payment addresses.

recent_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
recent_posts.summary:
- To address privacy concerns, we propose collecting anonymized data in a common CSV format.
- Certain fields will be randomized to maintain anonymity if data is exported to researchers.
- The proposed format includes various fields such as channel IDs, public keys, timestamps, and endorsement status.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a `keysend` protocol for multipath payments via embedding preimage as TLV 5482373484.
- Receiver claims payment once all parts of `keysend` with same payment hash have arrived.
- Scheme allows dynamic splitting of `keysend` into multiple parts without special announcement.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- Transcripts of the meetings are now available at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Gurwinder at Chaincode helped review and ensure the accuracy of the transcripts.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation discussed involves a blinded server that doesn't learn certain information.
- Blinded statechains rely on the server reporting the number of partial signatures generated.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol includes key aggregation, nonce aggregation, and message signing.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark, a new second-layer protocol, offers an alternative to the Lightning network.
- It allows users to send and receive funds without the need for liquidity constraints.
- By using virtual UTXOs and an untrusted intermediary, Ark enables anonymous, off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author has submitted a pull request to Bitcoin Core for enabling full-replace-by-fee by default.
- 40% of Bitcoin hash power mines full-rbf replacements across 8 different pools.
- Block explorers, nodes, and on-chain wallets support and enable full-rbf transactions.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed attackers to create balances using manipulated invoices.
- The team warns about similar exploits in other Lightning applications, especially custodial wallets and payment processors.
- The attack involved manipulating payment hashes to trick the backend and create a malicious invoice.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in New York City in late June.
- Attendees attempted to take transcript-style notes, available at the provided link.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network provide privacy benefits for receiving nodes.
- However, payments can only be made through these paths, potentially limiting decentralization.
- Concerns arise about payment tracking and the pressure to adopt this approach for regulatory compliance.
